summary: Email correspondence between defense attorneys and a federal prosecutor regarding discovery in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (US v. Maxwell). The emails discuss scheduling a call and the availability of an index of physical evidence seized by the FBI from Jeffrey Epstein's residences in 2019.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with the prosecution about viewing evidence and scheduling a call.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C., copied on the email correspondence regarding evidence in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, copied on the email correspondence regarding evidence in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding evidence in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (US v. Maxwell - 20 Cr. 330). The correspondence is about discovery in her case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the person whose residences were searched by the FBI in 2019, leading to the physical evidence being discussed.

connections.description: Menninger is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case US v. Maxwell.
Pagliuca is a defense attorney copied on correspondence regarding Maxwell's case, indicating involvement in her defense.
Everdell is a defense attorney copied on correspondence regarding Maxwell's case, indicating involvement in her defense.
Sternheim is a defense attorney copied on correspondence regarding Maxwell's case, indicating involvement in her defense.
The evidence being discussed was seized from Epstein's residences, and Maxwell is his co-conspirator in the related case.
They are corresponding as opposing counsel in the criminal case, discussing discovery logistics.

events.title: FBI searches of Epstein's residences
events.description: The FBI's New York Office conducted searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands, seizing physical evidence.

events.title: Discovery production to defense
events.description: The prosecution produced discovery to the defense, including an index of physical items from the FBI-Miami office and scans of numerous items.

events.title: Scheduled call regarding evidence
events.description: The prosecution and defense scheduled a call to discuss the defense's request to view evidence, highly confidential materials, and scenes.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The defense for Ghislaine Maxwell requested to view physical evidence, highly confidential materials, and scenes related to the case.
The prosecution provided an index of physical items in FBI custody from the FBI-Miami office, which was part of an August 21, 2020 discovery production.
Additional evidence includes search warrant returns listing items seized by the FBI's New York Office during 2019 searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
The prosecution noted that the FBI's New York Office evidence was not in a spreadsheet format but offered to request the FBI create a similar index.
Scans of numerous evidentiary items were previously produced and could be found within Bates range SDNY_GM_00172218-SDNY_GM_00173007.
